intro: Helleborine, commonly known as the helmet orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its unique, helmet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in shady, moist environments, often in woodlands or along stream banks. Helleborine species are perennial herbs with rhizomatous stems and are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
